com.tozny.e3db.crypto

Interface Crypto


  • public interface Crypto
    Provides cryptographic operations necessary for interacting with E3DB. Android and plain Java implementations of this class are automatically included in each respective client library.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decryptBox(CipherWithNonce message, byte[] publicKey, byte[] privateKey)
      Decrypt a message for a given recipient.

      Decrypts the given file, assuming it was encrypted with the given secret key.
      byte[] decryptSecretBox(CipherWithNonce message, byte[] key)
      Decrypt a message encrypted with a secret key.

      E3DBKeyPair deriveSigningKeyPair(char[] password, byte[] salt)

    • Method Detail

      • suite

        CipherSuite suite()

      • encryptSecretBox

        CipherWithNonce encryptSecretBox(byte[] message,
                                 byte[] key)
                          throws E3DBEncryptionException
        Encrypts a message using the secret key given.
        Parameters:
        message - Bytes to encrypt. Can be empty but not null.
        key - Secret key to encrypt with. Must be a 32-byte array. To generate a key, use newSecretKey().
        Returns:
        The encrypted message and a nonce used during encryption.
        Throws:
        E3DBEncryptionException

      • decryptSecretBox

        byte[] decryptSecretBox(CipherWithNonce message,
                        byte[] key)
                 throws E3DBDecryptionException
        Decrypt a message encrypted with a secret key.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to decrypt, along with the nonce used during encryption.
        key - Secret key for decryption. Should be a byte array previously generated with newSecretKey().
        Returns:
        The decrypted bytes, or throws an exception if decryption fails.
        Throws:
        E3DBDecryptionException

      • encryptBox

        CipherWithNonce encryptBox(byte[] message,
                           byte[] publicKey,
                           byte[] privateKey)
                    throws E3DBEncryptionException
        Encrypt a message using public-key cryptography.
        Parameters:
        message - Bytes to encrypt. Can be empty but never null.
        publicKey - The public key of the recipient. A 32-byte array.
        privateKey - Private key of the sender. A 32-byte array. Private keys can be generated with newPrivateKey().
        Returns:
        The encrypted message plus a nonce used during encryption.
        Throws:
        E3DBEncryptionException

      • decryptBox

        byte[] decryptBox(CipherWithNonce message,
                  byte[] publicKey,
                  byte[] privateKey)
           throws E3DBDecryptionException
        Decrypt a message for a given recipient.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to decrypt, plus a nonce used during encryption.
        publicKey - Public key of the sender (for authentication). A 32-byte array.
        privateKey - Private key of the recipient. A 32-byte array. Private keys can be generated with newPrivateKey().
        Returns:
        The decrypted message, or throws if decryption fails.
        Throws:
        E3DBDecryptionException

      • getPublicKey

        byte[] getPublicKey(byte[] privateKey)
             throws E3DBCryptoException
        Extract the public key from a given private key.
        Parameters:
        privateKey - A 32-byte array. Private keys can be generated withw newPrivateKey()).
        Returns:
        The public key, or throws if the argument does not represent a valid private key.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • newPrivateKey

        byte[] newPrivateKey()
              throws E3DBCryptoException
        Create a new private key for use with encryptBox(byte[], byte[], byte[]) and decryptBox(CipherWithNonce, byte[], byte[]). The associated public key can be extracted from the returned key using getPublicKey(byte[]).
        Returns:
        A new private key.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • newSecretKey

        byte[] newSecretKey()
        Generate a new secret key for use with encryptSecretBox(byte[], byte[]) and decryptSecretBox(CipherWithNonce, byte[]).
        Returns:
        A new secret key.

      • newPrivateSigningKey

        byte[] newPrivateSigningKey()
                     throws E3DBCryptoException
        Returns an Ed255119 private key that can be used for creating signatures.
        Returns:
        A new Ed25519 private key.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • getPublicSigningKey

        byte[] getPublicSigningKey(byte[] privateKey)
                    throws E3DBCryptoException
        Extract the public key portion from a secret signing key.
        Parameters:
        privateKey - Ed25519 private key.
        Returns:
        Public key portion of the private key.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • signature

        byte[] signature(byte[] message,
                 byte[] signingKey)
          throws E3DBCryptoException
        Creates an Ed25519 signature over the given message.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to sign.
        signingKey - Private Ed25519 key to use.
        Returns:
        An Ed25519 signature.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • verify

        boolean verify(Signature signature,
               byte[] message,
               byte[] publicSigningKey)
        Verify a signature, given a document and public key.
        Parameters:
        signature - The Ed255199 signature to verify.
        message - Message used to generate the signature.
        publicSigningKey - Public portion of the Ed25519 key used to create the signature given.
        Returns:
        true if the signatue was generated for the given document, using the private key associated with the public key given. false otherwise.

      • encryptFile

        java.io.File encryptFile(java.io.File file,
                         byte[] secretKey)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         E3DBCryptoException
        Encrypt the given file, using the key given, and return a reference to the encrypted file. Enough temporary space must be available on the device to store the encrypted file.
        Parameters:
        file - File to encrypt.
        secretKey - Key to encrypt with.
        Returns:
        The encrypted file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        E3DBCryptoException

      • decryptFile

        void decryptFile(java.io.File file,
                 byte[] secretKey,
                 java.io.File dest)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 E3DBCryptoException
        Decrypts the given file, assuming it was encrypted with the given secret key.
        Parameters:
        file - Location of file to decrypt
        secretKey - Key to use when decrypting.
        dest - The destination to write the decrypted contents to. If this file exists, it will be truncated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        E3DBCryptoException

      • hashString

        byte[] hashString(String message)
           throws E3DBCryptoException
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        Size of the block used when encrypting files (in bytes).
        Returns:
        block size in bytes.

      • deriveEncryptionKeypair

        E3DBKeyPair deriveEncryptionKeypair(char[] password,
                                    byte[] salt)
                             throws E3DBCryptoException
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

        E3DBKeyPair deriveSigningKeyPair(char[] password,
                                 byte[] salt)
                          throws E3DBCryptoException
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • randomBytes

        byte[] randomBytes(int bytes)
